TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DBFilesystem extends MonoTouch.Foundation.NSError

summary.para: The filesystem object provides a files and folder view of a user's Dropbox. The most basic operations are listing a folder and opening a file, but it also allows you to move, delete, and create files and folders.

remarks.para: The filesystem object provides a files and folder view of a user's Dropbox. The most basic operations are listing a folder and opening a file, but it also allows you to move, delete, and create files and folders.

public virtual bool CompletedFirstSync { get; }
.property instance bool CompletedFirstSync

summary.para: When a user's account is first linked, the filesystem needs to be synced with the server before it can be used. This property indicates whether the first sync has completed and the filesystem is ready to use.

remarks.para: When a user's account is first linked, the filesystem needs to be synced with the server before it can be used. This property indicates whether the first sync has completed and the filesystem is ready to use.

summary.para: Returns a list of objects representing the files contained in the folder at path. If <completedFirstSync> is false, then this call will block until the first sync completes or an error occurs.

remarks.para: Returns a list of objects representing the files contained in the folder at path. If <completedFirstSync> is false, then this call will block until the first sync completes or an error occurs.

para.para: An array of objects if successful, or nil if an error occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual DropBoxSync.iOS.DBFile OpenFile (DropBoxSync.iOS.DBPath path, out DropBoxSync.iOS.DBError error);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class DropBoxSync.iOS.DBFile OpenFile(class DropBoxSync.iOS.DBPath path, class DropBoxSync.iOS.DBError error) cil managed

summary.para: Opens an existing file and returns a [file]() object representing the file at path.

remarks.para: Opens an existing file and returns a [file]() object representing the file at path.

Files are opened at the newest cached version if the file is cached. Otherwise, the file will open at the latest server version and start downloading. Check the status property of the returned file object to determine whether it's cached. Only 1 file can be open at a given path at the same time.

para.para: The [file]() object if the file was opened successfully, or nil if an error occurred.

summary.para: Returns a bitmask representing all the currently active states of the filesystem OR'ed together. See the DBSyncStatus enum for more details.

remarks.para: Returns a bitmask representing all the currently active states of the filesystem OR'ed together. See the DBSyncStatus enum for more details.
